body:
A rationale behind this style of error message texts is simple. By copying exact failed function name to an error message we allow easier code search in case of potential problems. If we leave a less distinctive text like "failed to fetch name ..." then future developers potentially might have found it harder to find exact place in the code by searching through all similar messages. And yes, these error messages are for developers eyes mostly, because normally these functions do not fail. I removed "TF_" though, they are unnecessary, I agree.
Do you think we can leave it like this ?
